page.title: 12REIGATE ARCHITECTURE
page.content: There is a variety of architecture in Reigate from medieval to modern. At the{Priory}(now a school) in Bell St, an exhibition was held in l985 to show its 750 years of history. Augustinian Canons lived here first but later it became the home of noble families. There is a Holbein fireplace & a lovely staircase. In Bell St, there is also a Tudor Hall House. The{Church of St Mary}Magdalene,much restored in l983,dates from the l2thC. {"The Reigate Town Trail",}a walk published by the Reigate Society can be followed. There are several l6th, l7th & l8th C. shops & houses in West St & High St.{The Old Town Hall(l728) causes traffic problems in the town! A fine town{house called"The Barons" (l7l0) in Church St has been restored by Redlands for use as a Social Club. Their modern offices are nearby.
